title: Published Research Paper at COMPUTE 2024, ACM India Conference
description: Co-authored a research paper on log generation for collaborative problem-solving, presented at COMPUTE 2024 and published by Springer.
content:
Presented a research paper titled “Enhancing and Analyzing Log Generation for Collaborative Problem-Solving Activities: Video Analysis and OCR Techniques” at ACM India’s COMPUTE 2024 Conference at IIT Gandhinagar. This work was the result of an internship at e-Yantra, IIT Bombay.

The research focused on analyzing screen recordings and log data using OCR and video processing to extract insights on student interactions in a digital collaborative platform. The paper was published by Springer as part of the Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS, volume 2400) series.

Key Contributions:

  • Built a data pipeline with OpenCV, OCR, and Pandas that boosted data usability by over 200%
  • Analyzed learner behavior in computer-based environments
  • Presented and defended the work in front of academic peers

title: First Place at Unplugged 2.0 Hackathon
description: Won first place at Unplugged 2.0 Hackathon hosted by D. J. Sanghvi College with a smart travel assistant project powered by AI and real-time data processing.
content:
This hardware-focused hackathon challenged participants to bridge physical devices with smart software. Our team developed a travel assistant app powered by AI agents, integrated with real-time sensor data, maps, and crash detection.

Key Contributions:

  • Developed a context-aware AI agent using LangGraph for dynamic route queries
  • Built a crash detection model with YOLO v11 trained on custom dataset
  • Created a real-time smart routing system integrating incident data
  • Built a QGIS-powered city dashboard for better administrative planning

This was a milestone victory that helped me expand my skills beyond traditional software into IoT and smart city technologies.

gallery.caption: Live demo of crash detection and smart routing

title: Top 5 Finish at eYRC Robotics Competition
description: Achieved 5th place in the national-level e-Yantra Robotics Competition 2023-24 with a project involving machine learning, image processing, and GIS.
content:
Our team developed a project under the GeoGuide theme called Vanguard. We built a robot that could follow lines using WebSockets, detect objects using transfer learning, and map its position using QGIS.

Key Contributions:

  • Integrated Dijkstra’s Algorithm for pathfinding
  • Fine-tuned an image classifier to run on 100x100 low-res input
  • Plotted real-time robot movement using GIS

This interdisciplinary project strengthened my foundations in robotics, ML, and spatial data processing.
